did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Drawings and plans from competitions, students, and Ovaska's work as a professional and student.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Arthur Ovaska received his Bachelor of Architecture degree at Cornell University in 1974. After receiving his undergraduate degree at Cornell, Ovaska began graduate architecture studies with his mentor, professor and department chair O. M. Ungers. From 1974 to 1978, he collaborated with Ungers in Ithaca and Koand#x308;ln, Germany. Founded the office of Kollhoff andamp; Ovaska in Berlin in 1978 with Hans Kollhoff. Ovaska left Berlin in 1987 to accept a full-time academic position at Cornell. His career included appointments as director of undergraduate studies, director of graduate studies, and chair of the Department of Architecture.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Drawings and plans from competitions, students, and Ovaska's work as a professional and student.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Arthur Ovaska papers, #15-2-4329. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: 11x17 printed packet of final drawings, photocopies. Larger set of printed drawings, mixed with original sketches / working drawings, ink on trace paper
Collection of research and competition materials for the Salem Witch Trials Tercentenary Memorial Competition Program May 1991
Set of brochures for historic tours in Salem area
Chapter book, titled, The Devil in Massachusetts by Marion L. Starkey
Question/Answer sheet for questions about the competition
Site maps and photos (photocopies)
Volumes I and II of The Witchcraft Hysteria of 1692 by Leo Bonfanti

did.unittitle: Chapter book, titled, The Devil in Massachusetts by Marion L. Starkey

scopecontent.p: Large collection of original process drawings and sketches, pencil/ink on trace - Prints of fnal drawings (S); Final drawings, pencil on thick card stock paper;B/W photographs of site; Misc. items : NYTimes page, lecture advertisement, work from Welfare Island; Student projects by A.Ovaska
A miscellaneous collection of what appears to be one project. Most sketches are in plan and suggest site analysis / plan arrangement studies. Map of Berlin, prints.
Collection of sketches: Ink on trace paper, Ink on cardstock. Smaller folder 8.5x11 photocopies of a figure ground map, site.
Presentation boards for Berlin Museum Extension competition: small-scale prints of original drawings mounted on cardstock; study drawings, pencil on vellum; shadow study; Map of site
Contains a set of original drawings and presentation-quality prints for the Berlin Museum Garten, possibly curated for a lecture at Syracuse University.

Presentation boards for Berlin Museum Extension competition - for exhibition (?) depicting precedent studies of various gardens (prints), as well as 1-2 original drawings of the project pasted onto card stock.
Study drawings in plan, originals, pen on newsprint paper. Set of trace paper sketches, ink on trace paper/newsprint.
Set of vellum prints, of plan drawing/axon/perspectives.
An extensive collection of drawings related to the Berlin Museum Garden - a combination of originals, prints
Set of unlabeled sketches, ink on trace paper, relating to Berlin Museum garden. 2 maps of site, Berlin, Some colored

scopecontent.p: Shadow plan drawings, with precedent gardens included on sides. Section / elevation drawings, prints with original colored pencil work.

scopecontent.p: Board 01-D : 3 Elevation drawings, showing front elevation of Berlin Museum and 2 side elevations of the garden project, labeled Ansicht Lindenstrasse, Schnitt NN, and Schnitt M-M respectively, original colored pencil work over print.
Board 01-E : 3 section drawings through garden project, labeled Schnitt H-H, Schnitt J-J, and Schnitt K-K, original colored pencil work over print.

Board 01 - F : Longitudinal section drawing through Berlin museum and garden project proposal, original colored pencil work over print, labeled BMG : Berlin Museum Garten, Internat Bauasstellung 1984, Schmitt AA, Kolhoff and Ovaska.

Board 01 - G : Technical plan drawing of garden proposal, original colored pencil work over print, annotated with ground heights and dimensions, labeled BMG : Berlin Museum Garden, Internat Bauasstellung 1984, Vermessungsplan
